content:
The avatar is at (5, 9). 'george' is at (8, 18) and (8, 19), far away from the avatar, but potentially getting close to the 'quiet' citizens at (8,4) and (8,5). There are 'quiet' citizens nearby at (5, 11) ,(6,11) and (6,17). Moving right might be beneficial to get closer to the quiet citizens.
Action: 3
Feedback: Move right to get closer to the 'quiet' citizen at (5, 11) and (6,11) .
```Action: 3```

Okay, I see that I'm at (5, 10). There are 'quiet' citizens around me at (5, 11). 'george' is at (7, 18), (7, 19), (8, 18), (8, 19). I should move away from george and towards the quiet citizens. I'll try moving up.
Action: 5
I expect to move up, away from george.

The avatar is at (4, 10). George is at (7, 16) and (7, 17). There are quiet citizens at (2, 8), (2, 9), (3, 2), (3, 3), (3, 8), (3, 9), (3, 19), (4, 2), (4, 3), (4, 13), (4, 14), (4, 19), (5, 16), (5, 17), (6, 13), (6, 14), (6, 16), (6, 17), (8, 5), (9, 5). The closest quiet citizen is at (4, 13), and George is at (7, 16). I should move away from George. I will move to the right.
Action: 3

The avatar is at (4, 11). George is at (7, 16) and (7, 17). There are several 'quiet' citizens ('#') around. George is quite far away, but moving down would put me closer to him. Moving up would move me towards more quiet citizens. Let's move up.

Action: 5
I expect the avatar to move up, away from George and potentially closer to some 'quiet' citizens.

The avatar is at (3, 11). There are two 'george' at (7, 16), (7,17), '*' at (6, 16), (6, 17) and '&' at (5, 16), (5, 17).
There are many '#' around the avatar.
It seems like the 'george' is far away from the avatar and moving up will make the avatar closer to the '&', I should move up.
Action: 5

The avatar is at (2, 11). There are 'quiet' citizens to the left and right of me. There are also 'annoyed' citizens and 'george' at the right bottom of the map. I should try to stay away from george while converting the annoyed citizen to quiet citizen. I will go left.
Action: 2
I expect to move to the left, away from the center, and closer to the 'quiet' citizen.
``` Action: 2 ```

The avatar is at (2, 10). There are 'quiet' citizens at (2,8), (2,9), (2,19), (2,20), (3,2), (3,3), (3,8), (3,9), (3,13), (3,14), (3,19), (3,20), (4,2), (4,3), (4,13), (4,14), (5,16), (5,17), (6,14), (6,15), (6,16), (6,17), (8,5), (9,5).
There are 'annoyed' citizens with george at (6,16), (6,17), 'annoyed' citizens at (5,16), (5,17).

My strategy is to move away from the location where 'annoyed' citizens with george are.
I will move up.

Action: 5

The avatar is at (1, 10). There are two 'annoyed george' at (6, 16) and (6, 17) and two 'annoyed' citizens at (5, 16) and (5, 17). There are several 'quiet' citizens at (2, 9), (3, 2), (3, 3), (3, 9), (3, 13), (3, 14), (3, 19), (3, 20), (4, 13), (4, 14), (5, 16), (5, 17), (6, 14), (6, 15), (8, 5), (9, 5). I need to move toward the 'annoyed' citizens and use a cigarette on them. I will move right to get closer to the 'annoyed' citizens.
Action: 3

The avatar is at (1, 11). There are several 'quiet' citizens around, especially to the west. 'george' is to the east, and there are some 'annoyed' citizens as well. I should move to the west to better protect the 'quiet' citizens and avoid 'george'.
Action: 2

The avatar 'a' is at (1,10). There are many 'quiet' citizens '#' around. 'george' represented by '@' is at (5,14) and (5,15), and '*','&' are 'annoyed'. I need to move away from george and use cigarettes to turn the 'annoyed' back to 'quiet'. Moving up to (0,10) is blocked by a wall. Moving right to (1,11) may be a good idea for a short time since george is on the right side of the map at the moment. But there are two 'annoyed' citizens '&' at (4,17) and (4,18). Therefore I will move left to (1,9).
Action: 2
```Action: 2```
I expect to move to the left, away from the immediate threat of 'george'.

Okay, I see George is at (5, 14) and there are four 'annoyed' citizens at (3,17), (3,18), (4,17), (4,18). I am at (1,9). Need to avoid George and calm down the annoyed citizens to prevent them from turning quiet ones. Let's move to the right to get away from George.
Action: 3
I expect to move to the right and further away from George.
```Action: 3```

The avatar is at (1, 10). There are several 'annoyed' citizens around (1, 17), (1, 18), (2, 17), (2, 18), (4, 14), (4, 15), (5, 13), (5, 14), (5, 15), (6, 12), (6, 13). 'george' is at (4, 11). The closest 'annoyed' citizen is at (1, 17) and (1, 18). I will move right to get closer to the 'annoyed' citizens, then use a cigarette to turn them back to 'quiet' citizens.
Action: 3
I expect to move one step to the right.

Okay, I'm at (1, 11). There are 'annoyed' citizens to my right at (1,17) and (1,18), also more at (2, 17), (2, 18). 'George' is below me at (4,11), (4,12), (5,11), (5,12). A 'quiet' citizen is below me at (2,11) and (3,11). There are more 'quiet' citizens at (4,1) and (5,1), also at (6,20) and (9,7), (9,8). The objective is to survive and protect the 'quiet' citizens.

Given 'george' is below and there are 'annoyed' citizens to my right, I should try to move away from 'george' and towards 'quiet' citizens to protect them from being turned into 'annoyed' citizens. Moving down seems like the worst idea as 'george' is there, and I want to move away from him. I will move up and then left towards the 'quiet' citizens to protect them.

Action: 5
I will move up to create distance between my avatar and george.
```Action: 5```

The avatar is at (1, 11). 'george' is at (4, 11), which is below me. There are a lot of 'annoyed' citizens around, and also some 'quiet' citizens. I need to move away from george and try to convert 'annoyed' citizens back to 'quiet' citizens. Moving up might be a good first step to distance myself from 'george'.
Action: 5
I expect the avatar to move up, away from george.
